title: Harry Dunn: Parents appeal for witnesses who saw suspected driver of car which killed their son leave UK
text:
A British couple at the centre of a row over the diplomatic immunity of a woman alleged to have killed their son in a road traffic accident have appealed for witnesses who saw her leaving the country to come forward.

Harry Dunn, 19, died when his motorbike crashed into a Volvo outside an RAF military base in Northamptonshire on August 27.

The 42-year-old suspected driver, Anne Sacoolas, who is reportedly married to a US intelligence official, was granted diplomatic immunity following the accident.

Harry's parents, Charlotte Charles and Tim Dunn, have vowed to fly to Washington and take legal action against Ms Sacoolas.

Their spokesperson, Radd Seiger, has now called on anyone who saw her leave the UK to share what they know.

He said: "I would urge anyone, on either side of the Atlantic, who has any information relating to Mrs Sacoolas's return to the United States, whether before, during, or after her departure, to please come forward."
description: A British couple at the centre of a row over the diplomatic immunity of a woman alleged to have killed their son in a road traffic accident have appealed for witnesses who saw her leaving the country to come forward.
